isis.stitle: Spanish - Guía para Localización de Fallas del Sistema Eléctrico - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - ANTILOCK AIR BRAKE SYSTEM WITH TRACTION CONTROL: BENDIX - 9200, 9300 and 9400 - OPERATION - TRACTION ACTIVE LIGHT

svcproc.title: TRACTION ACTIVE LIGHT
svcproc.para: The traction active light is located in the right gauge cluster. This light turns ON for a bulb test when the key is turned on, then goes out. The light will turn ON during vehicle operation to indicate that the traction control system is currently working to reduce wheel slip that the sensors have detected. The traction active light receives ignition power (key ON) through connector (420), on circuit 28C from 10A fuse F4-A. The ground side of the traction active light is connected through a connector (420), circuit 94BD to controller, 30-way connector (355), and terminal C2.
The controller has a ground switch that opens (light OFF) and closes (light ON) the traction active light ground circuit in response to programmed instructions.
